prompt.content: Each of the two Magellan telescopes has a diameter of $6.5 \mathrm{~m}$. In one configuration the effective focal length is $72 \mathrm{~m}$. Find the diameter of the image of a planet (in $\mathrm{cm}$ ) at this focus if the angular diameter of the planet at the time of the observation is $45^{\prime \prime}$. Let's think step by step and output the final answer within \boxed{}.
